data.project_title: Establishing the ecosystem for community driven scanning probe microscopy research and development
data.project_abstract: Custom instruments designed by researchers in academia are a key resource for advancing discovery and technology. However, they are very difficult and thus rarely shared openly with the scientific community. In the previous Explore project we have built an OpenSPM ecosystem around our custom OpenSPM prototypes. Through the rapid growth and success of this project, we have identified what will be required to sustain the growth of the OpenSPM ecosystem to become a global platform for future SPM research and development. In this second Explore grant call, we will continue to increase the available open technology, focus on maintenance and long-term viability by developing a professional development framework, and expand the community through international outreach and expansion beyond the field of SPM. The result will be a long-term sustainable, globally distributed network of users and developers from academia and industry.

work_packages.wp_title: Remove reliance on commercial SPM components
Expand to other SPM microscope brands and applications; Compatibility with other microscope brands.
Establishing a professional hardware/software development and maintenance framework; Setting up a professional development framework.
Growing community beyond SPM applications; Expansion beyond SPM

project_title.reasoning: The most formal and complete project title is extracted from the research proposal section (indexed as 0), which serves as the primary location for such metadata. Although 'OpenSPM project' is used throughout the document as a shorthand or informal project name, the full descriptive title that best answers the query is the one provided in idx0. Therefore, the verbatim extraction from the research proposal table is used as the project title. Supporting references in later pages reinforce the association with the OpenSPM project/initiative, but they do not supersede the official title presented at the beginning.

work_packages.reasoning: Combined verbatim extractions. Used higher confidence title, and reported the mean extraction confidence. Both versions were virtually identical.
Combined close but not identical titles from both sources. Merged phrasing to retain all extracted concepts, and averaged the two extraction confidences.
Combined both extractions for completeness, reporting the mean of the confidence scores. Phrasing overlaps but includes more detail from one source.
Combined extractions for slightly different wording, averaged confidences. Both express the same WP objective.
Combined both extractions due to minor variation, both supported at full extraction confidence.

config.system_prompt:
EXTRACTION STRATEGY:
  1. PRIMARY: Look for data in the specified location/table/section
  2. FALLBACK: If not found, search broader document context for semantically equivalent information
  3. FLEXIBILITY: Allow for format variations, OCR errors, and synonym usage

  LOCATION FLEXIBILITY:
  - Handle table format variations (column/row order, spacing, naming)
  - Consider synonyms and equivalent terms
  - Account for OCR/parsing errors that may affect document quality

  QUALITY STANDARDS:
  - Extract actual values found in the document
  - If uncertain, provide best interpretation with appropriate confidence
  - Only return null if the information category truly doesn't exist
  - Convert abbreviated amounts (k=1000) to full numbers where applicable
  

  METADATA EXTRACTION FOCUS:
  - Project identification: title, acronym, duration, start date
  - Applicant details: names, institutions, functions, addresses
  - Project categorization: Explore/Establish/Contribute classification
  - Keywords and abstract information from research proposal sections
